intro: Eleocharis rivularis, commonly known as the river sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes, ponds, and along the edges of streams. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. Eleocharis rivularis is often found in shallow water or moist soil, and it plays a role in stabilizing aquatic environments. Its presence is an indicator of water quality and ecological health in wetland ecosystems.
